quiz.text: Which one of the following organisations has recently (July 2023) released the report __X__ mentioned in the passage?
options: Asian Development Bank
World Economic Forum
World Bank
IMF
New Development Bank

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released report __X__ mentioned in the above passage, __Y__ stands for the projected growth rate for India in 2023-2024. What is the value of __Y__?
options: 4.6%
3.5%
6.4%
6.1%
5.9%

quiz.text: According to the recently, (July 2023) released report __X__ mentioned in the above passage, the __Z__ stands for the projected global growth for both 2023 and 2024. What is the value of __Z__?
options: 3%
3.5%
2.8%
3.8%
3.2%

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released _X_ report mentioned in the passage, the projected growth rate for India in 2023 is 6.1%, which is a _____percentage point upward revision compared with the April projection.
options: 0.3
0.5
0.1
0.2
0.6

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released _X_ report mentioned in the passage, the Emerging markets developing economies (EMDEs) were projected to grow at ________ for 2023-2024.
options: 4.0
5.0
3.0
1.0
2.0

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (July 2023) released the “Assessment of Climate Change over the Indian Region” report?
options: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change
NITI Aayog
Ministry of Earth Sciences
India Meteorological Department
The Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released report “Assessment of Climate Change over the Indian Region”, India’s average temperature has risen by around __________ during 1901-2018.
options: 0.4oC
0.5oC
0.6oC
0.7oC
0.8oC

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released report “Assessment of Climate Change over the Indian Region”, the Summer monsoon precipitation (June to September) over India has declined by around ________ from 1951-2015.
options: 6%
7%
8%
9%
5%

quiz.text: Which of the following organization has recently (July 2023) released “Management Effectiveness Evaluation (MEE) of Tiger Reserves: Final Report- 5th cycle”?
options: International Union for Conservation of Nature
Worldwide Fund for Nature
United Nations Environment Programme
National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA)
Fauna and Flora International

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released Management Effectiveness Evaluation (MEE) of Tiger Reserves: Final Report- 5th cycle, India has declared a network of 53 Tiger Reserves spread across 18 States covering an area of 75,796.83 sq km. Of these, a total of _______ Tiger Reserves have been independently evaluated through the MEE process in the 5th cycle of MEE of Tiger Reserves in 2022.
options: 51
52
53
54
55

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released Management Effectiveness Evaluation (MEE) of Tiger Reserves: Final Report- 5th cycle, the overall mean score for 51 Tiger Reserves is ____________.
options: 79.01%
78.01%
77.01%
76.01%
75.01%

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released Management Effectiveness Evaluation (MEE) of Tiger Reserves: Final Report- 5th cycle, the __________ reserve topped with score of ______ among the 51 reserves that were evaluated. Satpura and Bandipur came second (93.18%), while Nagarhole was ranked third (92.42%)
options: Corbett Tiger Reserve & 94.08%
Similipal Tiger Reserve & 94.18%
Manas Tiger Reserve & 94.28%
Periyar Tiger Reserve & 94.38%
Kamlang Tiger Reserve & 94.48%

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released Management Effectiveness Evaluation (MEE) of Tiger Reserves: Final Report- 5th cycle, India has declared a network of 53 Tiger Reserves spread across 18 States covering an area of ____________.
options: 75,796.83 sq km.
75,796.73 sq km.
75,796.63 sq km.
75,796.53 sq km.
75,796.43 sq km.

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) “All India Tiger Estimation - 2022: Detailed Report” was released by the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA), it was first released in the year _______ and generally published after a gap of every ______ years.
options: 2007 & 5
2006 & 4
2005 & 3
2004 & 2
2003 & 1

quiz.text: All India Tiger Estimation - 2022: Detailed Report was recently (July 2023)  released by the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA), according to the findings of the report, India currently harbors almost _________ of the world’s wild tiger population.
options: 99%
95%
85%
75%
65%

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released “All India Tiger Estimation - 2022: Detailed Report” by the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA), which of the following state has the second highest tiger population?
options: Karnataka
Madhya Pradesh
Uttarakhand
Tamil Nadu
Maharashtra

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released “All India Tiger Estimation - 2022: Detailed Report” by the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA), which among the following states no tiger population is estimated for the second consecutive estimation?
options: Punjab
Madhya Pradesh
Nagaland
Goa
Gujarat

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released report “ECOWRAP” by the State Bank of India, continuously growing at _______ rate is the new normal for India.
options: 6-8%
6.3-7.5%
6.9-8%
6.5-7%
6.6-7.7%

quiz.text: The “ECOWRAP” report which was released recently (July 2023) by the State Bank of India, states that India's share in the global GDP will be ______ by 2027 and the economy will add ________ to its overall size every two years.
options: 4% & 0.75 trillion
3% & 0.85 trillion
2% & 0.95 trillion
2.5% & 0.80 trillion
2.6% & 0.88 trillion

quiz.text: According to the “ECOWRAP” report which was released recently (July 2023) by the State Bank of India, ____________ and __________ will breach the USD 500 billion mark on their respective GSDP by 2027.
options: Gujarat and Tamil Nadu
Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh
Telangana and Andhra Pradesh
Delhi and West Bengal
Kerala and Haryana

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released “Greenwich Leaders: Indian Corporate Banking 2023” by the Coalition Greenwich, which private sector bank has overtaken the State Bank of India to earn top spot in the market penetration.
options: HDFC Bank
Axis Bank
ICICI Bank
Yes Bank
HSBC Bank
